Preterit.text: disa ḥəlle mḥaǧaǧle aʕla: “ḥur! hat frə́slax-li taḥt i=mizən ḥatta d-nəflo aʕli!” ʻHe looked at [the scales] again and found a [new] pretext against her: “Look! You have made the bed for me under the scales that they may fall upon me!” 497; 41/14;

idioms: disputieren, streiten, einen Vorwand finden (gegen ʕal);
